reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Providing life-saving shelter and WASH services to the newly IDPs by establishing a planned camp in the Jarablus area

description.narrative:
ATAA is planning to conduct a multi-sectoral project that encompasses many activities from different sectors and aims at enhancing cohesion and recovery of the IDPs by reducing their shelter related vulnerabilities and diminishing their sufferings regarding camps and accommodation based on the Minimum Standards in Humanitarian Response. Establishing planned camp in jarablus sub-district (close to Marma Elhajar community) which is located in Euphrates shield areas as well as it is safe, the area of the land 23550 m2, this camp will be for a longer-term settlement for the IDPs that will ensure better shelter solutions for them. RHU (Refugee Housing Unit (Pilot project recommended)) will be established according to the standards of safety and privacy secured with locks and sufficient lighting and ensure accessibility for all persons including those with disabilities. If the RHU is not secured from the supplier, it will be replaced by tents. Schools, CFSs and safe spaces for women will be taken strongly into consideration. The camp will be including key administrative and critical humanitarian infrastructure: including firebreaks amp fire points, admin offices, and distribution points. this camp will provide shelter for 180 HHs (995 individuals) of newly IDPs from Idleb. the applied selection criterion is targeting all newly displaced HHs. Moreover, Ataa will develop a tool for beneficiaries’ registration that includes the following vulnerability indicators: Household demographic indicators Vulnerability status of household members Displacement status of households Accommodation status of the household Access to income each indicator has a weight that contributes to the combined household vulnerability Also, the project will increase capacity building for the newly displaced IDPs and enhance participation of displaced women and girls and other people by conducting CCCM training inside the camp, this training will be conducted by ATAA (Certified trainer of CCCM). In addition to conducting the PSEA/GBV awareness-raising sessions to the beneficiaries to protecting them from sexual exploitation and abuse. Through this project and under WASH sector ATAA will: - Distribute and install 5 water storage tanks 5000 L/capacity depending on the need for water tanks in the camp, in addition to establishing water gender-separated taps 3 for women and 3 for men to avoid crowded and long waiting by beneficiaries. - Provide and install pre-fabricated of public toilets (Caravan) 10 gender-separated WASH containers with a septic tank, 25 to 30 persons for each toilet, (4 latrines one of them dedicated to PWDs and 1 bathroom), in addition to dislodging the solid pits regularly. Recruitment of volunteers from the most vulnerable in the camp (male and female) to clean latrines unites on a daily basis to help them improve their temporary income (Cash for work). - Activate SWM process by providing 18 garbage bins-capacity 100L (1 bin for 10 families) and renting garbage trucks and employees to collect the garbage on a daily bases to move the garbage to the main landfills. - Improve hygienic behavior and practices by distributing 180 Hygiene kits in addition to conducting hygiene awareness sessions for 995 persons. During implementing project activities and in case our camp has new and additional arrivals, the newly IDPs will benefit from all project activities, and in case increasing of IDPs in project camp, ATAA will inform WASH cluster and will work to get new fund and target the IDPs with WASH activities. In all the above-mentioned activities, Ataa will integrate protection precautions to ensure the prevention of any gender-based violence. ATAA will also establish a complaint mechanism (hotline), and a participatory monitoring system through working with local authorities, and beneficiary representatives.
HRP Project Code: HSYR20-CCM-165392-1 / HSYR20-SHL-164415-1
